greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers k such that 2*k^k - 1 is prime.
example: 3 is in the sequence since 2*3^3 - 1 = 53 is prime.
xref: Numbers k such that b*k^k - b + 1 is prime: this sequence (b=2), A301521 (b=4), A302123 (b=6).
results.author: _Ray G. Opao_, Sep 25 2005
